channel.title: Probability on A data enthusiast blog - another wannabe 'statistician'
channel.description: Recent content in Probability on A data enthusiast blog - another wannabe 'statistician'

item.title: Probability Function
item.description: Probability function is the function of a random variable distribution, whose value provides the absolute or relative likelihood of the value of the random variable in the sample. Depending on the type of our random variable, we can calculate: Absolute likelihood for a discrete variable Relative likelihood for a continuous variable On this page we will discuss: Probability Mass Function Probability Density Function Popular PMFs and PDFs Probability Mass Function Discrete random variables have discrete and countable values.

item.title: Discrete Probability Distribution
item.description: Probability distributions demonstrate the probability of an event. When dealing with discrete data, probability mass function of the event can come from various distributions. The most important discrete probability distributions are the Bernoulli, Binomial and Poisson. Bernoulli distribution The most widely known unknown discrete probability distribution is the Bernoulli distribution. Named after the Swiss mathematician Jacob Bernoulli, the Bernoulli distribution is the probability distribution of the outcome of a single experiment with two possible outcomes.
